info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:41PM EDT until July 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MADISON...NORTH CENTRAL ALBEMARLE AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 841 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stanardsville, or 11 miles southwest of Madison, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Stanardsville, Mcmullen, Amicus, Lydia, Haneytown, Saint George and Advance Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
